METS:xmlData.dcterms:title: »Mesto, ki mu Kranjec pravi le Kranj...«
METS:xmlData.dcterms:alternative: "The Town Called Solely Kranj by the Carniolans..."
METS:xmlData.dcterms:creator: Žibert, Marjana
Rogelj, Monika
METS:xmlData.dcterms:abstract: V članku je strnjeno predstavljen zgodovinski razvoj Kranja od zgodnjega srednjega veka do danes. Posebej je poudarjena prva omemba Kranja kot mesta v pisnih virih iz leta 1256. Kranj spada med najstarejša slovenska mesta, mestne pravice in grb so mu v prvi polovici 13. stoletja podelili grofje Andeški. Dolga stoletja je veljal za sejemsko mesto z velikim ugledom in je imel pomembno vlogo v tranzitnem prometu. V 17. stoletju se je dokončno izoblikovala mestna veduta grajena v obliki piramide s cerkvenimi zvoniki, obzidjem in obrambnimi stolpi, ki je ena najlepših v evropskem prostoru in nam jo je ohranil topograf Mathias Merian. Odprtje gorenjske železnice je mestu omogočilo razvoj manufaktur in manjših industrijskih podjetij. Med obema svetovnima vojnama je Kranj z vlaganji tujih in domačih podjetnikov postal drugo najpomembnejše središče tekstilne industrije v Sloveniji. Po drugi svetovni vojni sta imeli največji pomen elektro in gumarska industrija. Kranj ima tudi vlogo regionalnega središča Gorenjske.

Examined is the historical development of the town of Kranj since the Early Middle Ages. First mentioned as a town with city rights in written sources from 1256, Kranj is one of the oldest towns in Slovenia. It was awarded city rights and its coat-of-arms by the counts of Andechs in the first half of the 13th Century. For many centuries the town was regarded as a renowned market town whose im portance for transit traffic was considérable. Its silhouette in the form of a pyramid with church belfries, city walls, and defense towers, acquired its final shape in the 17th Century and is one o f the most beautiful European vedutes. It has been preserved on paper by topographer Mathias Merian. With a new railway that passed through the town the development of manufactures and small industrial plants started to flourish. In the period between the First and the Second World Wars foreign and domestic investments made Kranj the second most important center of textile industry in Slovenia. Decades later, after WWII, the town was the center of electric and rubber industries and is still the regional center of Gorenjsko.

Odprtje gorenjske železnice je mestu omogočilo razvoj manufaktur in manjših industrijskih podjetij.
